quest.name: Her Children, One and All
journal: Fourchenault is ready to lead you to Hydaelyn at last.

Satisfied with your level of preparedness, Fourchenault makes for the center of Thaumazein and invites you to follow. Given his lingering trepidation, however, you cannot help but wonder what as-yet-untold dangers await...

At Thaumazein's heart, Fourchenault explains that the bright blue and seemingly bottomless well of aether beneath you is the aetherial sea, and that the nearby shaft connects to the “Aitiascope,” a massive device by which the Forum peers into its depths to seek dialogue with Hydaelyn. Unfortunately, they have found little success since the Calamity weakened Her power, so you will be required to dive deeper than the Sharlayans ever dared if you would seek Her out. There, Fourchenault warns, drift memories strong enough to have escaped purgation by the cleansing tides, which may attempt to bar your path in death as they did in life...

※To enlist your companion NPCs for this duty, speak with them near the entrance or access Duty Support via the main menu. Use the Duty Finder if you wish to complete the instance alongside fellow players.

With a little help from old friends, you fight your way past the vestiges of once-conquered foes to meet a soul but recently cast into the abyss, clinging to the world of the living even as he curses its hollowness. His parlor tricks are of no moment with the erstwhile Lady Iceheart shielding you once more, yet you struggle to destroy him once and for all. Instead, it is the vengeful spirit of Asahi who brings an end to the man that was once Hermes, many times Fandaniel, but Amon at the last, leaving the path to Hydaelyn open before you.

At the Mothercrystal, Hydaelyn welcomes you warmly, and gives the answer you sought─Meteion and the despair over which she presides can still be overcome. She cautions, however, that to do so will require tremendous power, and that a failed attempt means an end to your star and all life upon it. Thus does She challenge you to take up arms against Her, the very god of Light whose voice has echoed in your heart for so long, and prove your worth.

※To enlist your companion NPCs for this duty, speak with them near the entrance or access Duty Support via the main menu.
※Use the Duty Finder if you wish to complete the instance alongside fellow players.

With trust in your allies and resolve in your heart, you bring your hard-won might to bear against the avatar of divine Light. Her talents are many, Her refulgence blinding, but though it is a trial in every sense of the word, you and your comrades triumph.

In testing your power, Hydaelyn has exhausted the last of Her own. But all was by design, for Her plans from time immemorial were a means to this end, in which man proclaims himself ready to dictate his own future. In parting, She bequeaths you three gifts─the crystal that shall guide you to Meteion, the Mothercrystal's aether to see you there, and Her own power to give form to the formless, secured in Azem's own crystal. The last of these, She cautions, is not to be relied on overmuch, for only within yourself will you find deliverance.

With Hydaelyn's words still ringing in your ears, you return to report what you have learned to Fourchenault, Krile, and Livingway. Fourchenault assures his children that Sharlayan's starship is yours to do with as you will, while Livingway eagerly collects Meteion's crystal that the Loporrits may chart your course, encouraging you to take a well-earned rest in the meantime.

You have no difficulty drifting off upon falling into bed at the Baldesion Annex, yet your peaceful slumber is interrupted by the strangest dream of a familiar voice in one-sided conversation. Is this merely an echo brought to mind by your extended exposure to the aetherial sea, or something more?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: To think how many generations labored for this end...and that we aim higher still.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We must spare no preparation─and that means speaking with Hydaelyn, no matter the cost.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I can well imagine the zeal with which they're working on the aetherburner, and all I can say is that I'm glad we have something to do other than get in their way.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Once it's ready, we'll see to it that the ship is put to good use!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I doubt this is what Erenville meant when he said that there remains much we do not know, but I still can't believe everything that was hidden underneath the city this entire time.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: 'Twould seem enchantments most advanced have been woven into the ship's very bones. Wilfsunn and Bloewyda were doubtless called upon for their expertise in teleportation magicks...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: We must learn of Hydaelyn's greater plan. We can only hope that She also knows the current location of Meteion...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: ...And we can do neither if we do not focus on whatever trial awaits us within.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: It was the Allagans who first combined the mechanical and aetherial sciences into a revolutionary discipline.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Given that this ship is nothing short of a technological marvel in that precise vein, Allagan salvage should suit it well.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: You feel it too, don't you? The ship is impressive, but it pales in comparison to the vast primordial power beneath our feet...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: If meeting Hydaelyn proves difficult even for the Forum, then perhaps I─

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Oh, 'tis an unformed idea at this phase, I'm afraid. I will duly inform you if anything comes of it.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: We make for the lift at the center of this chamber. Come.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: This doesn't strike me as particularly dangerous, unless one is afraid of lifts.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: With the ship in the way, I didn't even notice this was here!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: They must employ a full cohort of engineers just to maintain the lifts...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: As a means of communing with the heart of the star, 'tis disappointingly mechanical in design...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The aether here is more brilliant than I have ever seen.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: ...Am I the only one feeling terribly nervous? Surely not.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: I doubt there's anything worth worrying over. Not for Hydaelyn's champion, at any rate.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: I should hope that Master Fourchenault has more to share ere sending anyone stumbling into the aetherial sea.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: As you all know, alongside our physical world exists an aetherial plane─what we refer to as the “aetherial sea.”

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: At the heart of the star, the physical and aetherial are one and the same. Thus, the deeper we go, the easier it becomes to pass between said planes.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: We utilized this principle in constructing the Antitower, and once more here in Thaumazein.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: No sooner did the Forum decide that an exodus from the star would be necessary than it began work on this facility.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: Our work culminated in a device that allowed us to peer deeper into the aetherial sea than ever before, in search of Hydaelyn's ever-fainter echoes...

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: The Aitiascope.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: And you communicate with Her through this device?

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: For a time, yes, but since the Seventh Umbral Calamity, it has been rare to hear even a whisper.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: If you wish to reach Her, you must journey closer to the center of the star than we have ever dared, beyond the Aitiascope.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: Even so, I make no guarantee that you will find Her. Nor of your safety─not so deep in the aetherial sea.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We understand. But if we are to deliver this world, we have no choice but to try.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: ...I know. I only wish we could do more than observe your progress from afar.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: The Aitiascope's ocular lens, by which we may peer into the aetherial sea without placing ourselves at hazard, lies above us. Through it, we can watch and guide you.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: In those swirling depths, there are pockets of aether so dense and turbulent that they can unravel one's soul. If we determine that you are at risk of coming into contact with such a pocket, we will recall you with teleportation magicks.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: To that end, it would be best if one familiar with the composition of your souls remained here to assist in assessing said risk. Otherwise, there is an increased probability that we will extract you too early...or too late.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Please, allow me.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: I have thought upon this much, and...in truth, I do not believe that I am fit to join you in the trials ahead.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: The events at the Tower of Babil drained me, yes, but even before that, your capabilities far outstripped my own.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: This is no time to have a weak link in our vanguard. No matter how much she may wish it were otherwise.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: ...If I assist in the manner that Master Fourchenault has laid out, however, I may still be of use.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Will you trust in me to do so?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I can think of none I'd trust more! Compared to all that effort you put into keeping us alive while our souls were in the First, preventing us from dissolving into aether on a single expedition ought to pose no challenge at all.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: And even if we did, I expect you would hunt us down and restore us to health somehow.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: You flatter me! But rest assured that I will be keeping a close eye on all of you.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: There is one more thing...

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: Those in ages past referred to the aetherial sea as the “Underworld,” our final resting place.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: In its embrace is memory washed away, leaving only the purity of one's soul...or so we believe.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: Yet what of these memories? Few think to ask what becomes of them, cast adrift on aetherial tides.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: Some theorize that they linger for some time─those associated with strong sentiment, in particular.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: In those depths, memories of the departed may even coalesce around you, for hatred or for love.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: Thus do I caution you to be wary─but also to have faith. Remember those who did gladly extend a hand to you, that they may lift you up once more.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Small talk.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Form a party and enter the Aitiascope.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We have always tried to do the right thing...but we have not always been kind, nor merciful.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I should not be surprised if some few harbored resentment for us as they passed on...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We must face these truths, and meet them as they come.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Maybe our enemies are down there. But if we've beaten them once, we can beat them again.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I'm more concerned about our meeting with Hydaelyn. We may find our truth, but what if...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: ...No, I would rather not think on it. Let us move on.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: If some part of them remains in the aetherial sea, do you think...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: ...Forgive me. That's not why we're here. And no matter what happens, she'll always be with us─with Ryne, most of all.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: She'd tell us to live for the here and now. To do what must be done. And we will.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: If Hydaelyn be unwilling or unable to divulge Meteion's location, I shall see our comrades delivered to the moon, one and all.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: I pray, however, that this eventuality doth not come to pass.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: While even a sliver of hope remaineth, we must needs fight on.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I now understand why these facilities are so heavily guarded.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: If it fell into the wrong hands, the wisdom of Hydaelyn could be dangerous, 'tis true...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: However, that danger is naught compared to what would result should the commonfolk en masse venture into the aetherial sea unprepared─which they most certainly would, if they thought it would allow them to speak to the dead!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Once that secret got out, no rational argument could dissuade people from wanting to see their loved ones, no matter how ephemeral the meeting.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I cannot help but think of those who were transformed into beasts.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Their aether dissolved into nothingness, their souls forever lost...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Yet I daresay Fandaniel still wanders the aetherial sea. As do ancients who gave rise to Zodiark, setting in motion so many cataclysmic events...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: If there is a justice or morality at work that governs our fates, I do not know it. Nor do I think any man ever will.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: I've seen more than enough death in my time. Friends, enemies...far too many to count.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Once, revenge was all I lived for. All that hate, all that anger...what good did it do?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: None, that's what. Way I see it, there's no point living for the past. It's the present that needs protecting.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: I hope to guide you via linkpearl while you're inside, but given the density of the aether, I'm not sure how long the connection will hold.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Even if you can't hear me, however, be assured that I am watching over you.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: Once you are below, you should proceed through the Aitiascope to the central observatory.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: That is where the objective lens is located. We can manipulate it to direct an aetherial current deeper into the sea.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: Though I shall assist you in every way possible, this is your journey to make. When you are ready, I bid you step forth.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: Proceed to the Mothercrystal?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: During this quest and when using the Duty Support system, you have the opportunity to undertake this trial with a party of Scions. Some of these allies' roles will differ from those you are normally able to select.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Additionally, you may now enter the Aitiascope with a party of NPC avatars. To make use of this feature, open the Trust interface located under Duty in the main menu.

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Small talk.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Form a party and face Hydaelyn.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: If strength is the courage to confront your failings and accept that you are worthy of another chance...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: To rise from the ashes while the fire still burns...bloodied but unbowed...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Then my friends have made me strong.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Emet-Selch called us incomplete. “Pitiful creatures,” he said, and maybe we are.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Pain, grief, fear... They walk with us wherever we go.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: But we proved to him that we deserve to live, and we'll prove it to Hydaelyn, Meteion...to the universe itself, if we must!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Pain and despair...aye, we're old friends. I've lost count of the times I've cursed my own powerlessness.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: But it's the blessed moments in between that I choose to hold in my heart. Memories...and possibilities. I fight to keep those things alive.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Minfilia and Ryne─to say nothing of you lot, I know─would never settle for less.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Hmm... Methinks we possess a surfeit of healers.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Perhaps I shall call upon mine Amber Carbuncle in lieu of celestial blessings...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Fear not─from unity and camaraderie doth my strength arise, not my choice of magicks.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Should we bring our singular talents to bear as one, even gods may fall.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: ...Nevertheless, I prithee throw thyself not into peril, lest our curative resources be spent.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: From the ruins of a sundered paradise did She rise, to grant this star new life.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: As its will, long has She labored to guide Her children.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Make no mistake─this trial puts to proof Hydaelyn's own faith.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Never─in the past, present, or future─have I found only happiness. To live is to be ever beset by hardships great and small.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Yet it is in adversity we find the strength to strive for the next moment of peace, and the next, no matter what trials we face.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: By this strength have the will of gods been defied and the fortunes of men been forever changed. May it be so again this day.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: What─surprised to hear me and “love” mentioned in the same breath?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: I've not a heart of stone. Even in my darkest hour, there were people I cared for. Mentors, comrades... That mad woman who gave her life for us...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Then you and Alphinaud threw my eyes off a bridge, and I've never known peace since.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: She has given us all She can.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We must share what we know with Father and the Loporrits at once, that it not go to waste.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I will keep Hydaelyn's words in my heart─as talisman and lodestone both.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: She and Hydaelyn were two of a kind, weren't they?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Full of love for the star and its people. Always holding to hope for our future...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: 'Tis fortunate that Fourchenault hath kept Livingway apprised of our progress. We require the Loporrits' aid more than ever.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Far be it from me to refute Hydaelyn's own words... Yet even if Her actions were neither kind nor just, we can yet give them a nobler meaning.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: We can make Her faith the salvation of mankind.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: If dynamis is ruled by emotion, perhaps prayer has more tangible results than I suspected─albeit ones that are not always obvious to us.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: In which case, we may hope that Hydaelyn's wishes continue to move the hearts of men as they set forth time and time again.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: A bit small for a welcoming party, but I've never been one for crowds.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Thank goodness! I never would have forgiven myself had any of you come to harm.

dialogue.name: LIVINGWAY
dialogue.text: Forename! Did you meet Hydaelyn? Pray tell─how is She?

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: I am glad to see you well. Though we could roughly place your souls, deep as you went, we could neither see nor hear you...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: The fluctuations in your aether near the end gave me quite a fright! What in the world happened?

dialogue.name: LIVINGWAY
dialogue.text: You mean to say Hydaelyn is...is...

dialogue.name: LIVINGWAY
dialogue.text: No, there's no time to feel our feelings! We must carry out Hydaelyn's will without delay.

dialogue.name: LIVINGWAY
dialogue.text: We'll find Meteion if it's the last thing we do!

dialogue.name: LIVINGWAY
dialogue.text: ...If you wouldn't mind handing over the crystal, that is. The fancy navigatory one.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: To the edge of the universe, where congregates the despair of countless stars... You are determined to see this through?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We are. Should words fail us, we will fight...to the bitter end.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I know that it pains you to accept this. Would that I need ask nothing more of you...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Yet we have only two means to travel the great expanse─the moon, and Sharlayan's ark. I am all too aware that without both of them, there will be no exodus...but I nevertheless beg you to honor the agreement we made.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: The Forum's decision will be honored. You have earned the right to use the ship as you see fit, and I could not rescind it even if I wanted to.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: As it happens, I do not, and would do all within my power to aid your cause.

dialogue.name: LIVINGWAY
dialogue.text: With that settled, might I suggest you rest a while?

dialogue.name: LIVINGWAY
dialogue.text: Proving oneself to Hydaelyn is never easy...and despite our unparalleled genius, we'll need a day to make the necessary calculations. You may as well take advantage of it!

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: You can chart a course through the sea of stars in a single day!? Ye gods...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Shall we head above ground for some fresh air, then? And perhaps a nap...

dialogue.name: OJIKATSUNJIKA
dialogue.text: Aha! I've been expecting you.

dialogue.name: OJIKATSUNJIKA
dialogue.text: I heard about your foray into the aetherial sea. The Students have ventured far and wide, but never quite so deep as that!

dialogue.name: OJIKATSUNJIKA
dialogue.text: Are you experiencing any aftereffects from your prolonged exposure? Nausea? Dizziness? Hauntings? Hmm...

dialogue.name: OJIKATSUNJIKA
dialogue.text: Well, have a pleasant sleep! And if you do experience any unusual phenomena, please let me know. I shall add it to our records!

dialogue.name: Q4
dialogue.text: Retire to your chamber?
